We have met before, and will again, one day.

When owls rehearse their solemn tunes,
And silver ghosts in tattered gowns
Parade beneath a silent moon.

The world is stitched with unseen thread,
Where secrets float on misty streams,
And every heartbeat in my chest
Becomes the drum of distant dreams.

I lie awake and watch the dark,
A canvas smeared with ink and doubt,
And wonder what the morning brings
When night’s illusions fade out.

IT is the dead of night,
But something stirs inside the gloom—
A hope, a fear, a whispered light
That promises the dawn will bloom.

It is the dead of night:
A phrase that chills the blood and bone,
Yet in this deep and hollow hush,
I find a place that feels like home.

The world’s asleep, the city still,
No engines groan or sirens call.
I wander through this empty calm,
A king within my shadowed hall.

The stars above are fierce and bright,
Their silver songs a lullaby.
I close my eyes and sail away
On midnight’s gentle, endless tide.

It is the dead of night, I know—
Yet here I live, and here I grow.
